“from scipy.interpolate import griddatan”, “import gcn”, “class Interface1D():n”, ” “”“Class for every interface related 1D output. Unstructured grid input.n”, ” n”, ” Attributes:n”, ” xarray: equal distanced x grid n”, ” <field>data: row data of <field>n”, ” <field>: interpolated data of <field>, including eta/p/grad/dudy/uxw… n”, ” “”“n”, ” n”, ” def __init__(self, L0, N, path, t, PRUNING=True, pre=’/field/eta_loc_t’):n”, ” “”“Example of docstring on the __init__ method.n”, “n”, ” The __init__ method may be documented in either the class leveln”, ” docstring, or as a docstring on the __init__ method itself.n”, “n”, ” Either form is acceptable, but the two should not be mixed. Choose onen”, ” convention to document the __init__ method and be consistent with it.n”, “n”, ” Note:n”, ” Do not include the self parameter in the Args section.n”, “n”, ” Args:n”, ” L0, N: The desired output grid numbern”, ” working_dir: The case’s directoryn”, ” t: Time of this eta file.n”, ” PRUNING: If eta is output by multiple processes and have multiple headersn”, ” (only applicable to MPI processed file). n”, ” pre: the prefix of the desirable data file.n”, ” “”“n”, ” self.L0 = L0; self.N = N; self.t = tn”, ” self.xarray = np.linspace(-self.L0/2.,self.L0/2.,self.N,endpoint=False)+self.L0/2**self.N/2 # Centered grid for interpolationn”, ” filename = path + pre + ‘%g’ %self.tn”, ” snapshot = pd.read_table(filename, delimiter = ‘,’)n”, ” snapshot = snapshot.sort_values(by = [‘x’])n”, ” # Field entriesn”, ” # x,pos,epsilon,p,p_p1,p_p2,dudy1,dudy2,dvdx1,dvdx2,dudx1,dudx2,dvdy1,dvdy2,uxa,uya,uxw,uywn”, ” if PRUNING:n”, ” snapshot = snapshot[snapshot.x != ‘x’]n”, ” snapshot = snapshot.astype(‘float’)n”, ” snapshot = snapshot[snapshot.pos < 0.4/(2*np.pi)] # Exclude data over slope 0.4n”, ” n”, ” self.xdata = np.array(snapshot.x, dtype=float)n”, ” self.etadata = np.array(snapshot.pos, dtype=float)n”, ” self.pdata = np.array(snapshot.p, dtype=float)n”, ” self.graddata = np.array(snapshot.epsilon, dtype=float)n”, ” self.dudydata = np.array(snapshot.dudy1, dtype=float)n”, ” self.dvdxdata = np.array(snapshot.dvdx1, dtype=float)n”, ” self.dudxdata = np.array(snapshot.dudx1, dtype=float)n”, ” self.dvdydata = np.array(snapshot.dvdy1, dtype=float)n”, ” self.uxwdata = np.array(snapshot.uxw, dtype=float)n”, ” self.uywdata = np.array(snapshot.uyw, dtype=float)n”, ” del (snapshot); gc.collect() # Only necessary for 2D for memory issue n”, ” n”, ” # Interpolate over x, ‘nearest’ is used to ensure that none of the interpolated point is ‘nan’ n”, ” self.eta = griddata(self.xdata.ravel(), self.etadata.ravel(), self.xarray, method=’nearest’)n”, ” self.p = griddata(self.xdata.ravel(), self.pdata.ravel(), self.xarray, method=’nearest’)n”, ” self.dudy = griddata(self.xdata.ravel(), self.dudydata.ravel(), self.xarray, method=’nearest’)n”, ” self.dvdx = griddata(self.xdata.ravel(), self.dvdxdata.ravel(), self.xarray, method=’nearest’)n”, ” self.dudx = griddata(self.xdata.ravel(), self.dudxdata.ravel(), self.xarray, method=’nearest’)n”, ” self.dvdy = griddata(self.xdata.ravel(), self.dvdydata.ravel(), self.xarray, method=’nearest’)n”, ” self.grad = griddata(self.xdata.ravel(), self.graddata.ravel(), self.xarray, method=’nearest’)n”, ” self.uxw = griddata(self.xdata.ravel(), self.uxwdata.ravel(), self.xarray, method=’nearest’)n”, ” self.uyw = griddata(self.xdata.ravel(), self.uywdata.ravel(), self.xarray, method=’nearest’)n”, ” n”, ” def uwater(self,):n”, ” “”” Water velocity decomposition.n”, ” The arrays are:n”, ” uwx_smooth: smoothed direct output of uwn”, ” uwx_orbit: orbital velocity from direct output of eta, u component (simplest estimation)n”, ” uwy_orbit: orbital velocity from direct output of eta, v componentn”, ” ud: analytical time dependent drift, constant along xn”, ” uwx_analy: ud + uwx_orbitn”, ” “”“n”, “n”, ” plt.figure(figsize=[4,2])n”, ” from scipy.signal import hilbertn”, “n”, ” # Output water velocityn”, ” plt.plot(interface.xdata, interface.uxwdata, c=’C0’, alpha = 0.5) # Water velocity n”, ” plt.plot(interface.xdata, interface.uywdata, c=’C2’, alpha = 0.5) # Water velocity n”, ” uxw_smooth = butter_lowpass_filter(interface.uxw_tile, CUT=4)n”, ” uyw_smooth = butter_lowpass_filter(interface.uyw_tile, CUT=4)n”, ” plt.plot(interface.xarray, uxw_smooth, c=’C0’, label = ‘$u_s$, simu’) # Water velocity n”, ” plt.plot(interface.xarray, uyw_smooth, c=’C2’, label = ‘$v_s$, simu’) # Water velocity n”, “n”, ” # The analytical water velocityn”, ” # plt.plot(interface.xarray, interface.eta_tile*case.wave.c*2*np.pi) # The orbital velocityn”, ” from scipy.special import gamman”, ” t = 2n”, ” ud = t**0.5*gamma(1)/gamma(3/2)/850 * (case.ustar*case.wave.c)**2 * (2*np.pi/case.wave.omega/(1/case.Re))**0.5 # Drift according to theoretical solutionn”, ” eta = butter_lowpass_filter(interface.eta_tile, CUT=4) # Filter etan”, ” analytic_signal = hilbert(eta)n”, ” phase = np.unwrap(np.angle(analytic_signal))n”, ” uwx_orbit = eta*case.wave.c*2*np.pin”, ” uwy_orbit = eta*case.wave.c*2*np.pi/np.cos(phase)*np.cos(phase-np.pi/2)n”, ” uwx_analy = ud + uwx_orbitn”, “n”, ” plt.plot(interface.xarray, uwx_orbit, ‘–’, c=’C1’, label=’$u_w$, analy’, alpha = 0.5)n”, ” plt.plot(interface.xarray, uwy_orbit, ‘–’, c=’C2’, label=’$v_w$, analy’, alpha = 0.5)n”, ” plt.plot(interface.xarray, uwx_analy, ‘–’, c=’C0’, label = ‘$u_w$ + $u_d$, analy’)n”, “n”, ” plt.plot(interface.xarray, eta, c=’gray’, alpha = 0.5)n”, ” plt.xlabel(r’$x/\lambda$’)n”, ” plt.ylabel(r’$u_s,v_s$’)n”, ” plt.xlim([-0.5,0.5])n”, ” plt.ylim([-0.05,0.1])n”, ” plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.02, 0.5), loc = ‘center left’)n”, ” def vis”
